description: Links, info and directions to follow

title: Lavenham Little Hall Museum
summary: Contemporary Arts and Crafts in an historic 14th Century House and Gardens
description: A stunning variety of Ceramics, Jewellery, Paintings, Prints, Blacksmith, Textiles, Spinning and Weaving and other Arts and Crafts. Demonstrations throughout the exhibition. Free entry.

title: Norfolk & Norwich Open Studios
summary: The county's artists open their doors to the public
description: For two weeks in May/June each year Norfolk & Norwich Open Studios celebrates the county's artists and their achievements, when they open their doors to the public to exhibit, sell and talk about their work. I am delighted to be a part of this event and hope to see you at my studio in Diss.

title: WoW Music Festival
summary: WoW is acoustic, roots, ska, bluegrass and everything in between mixed up with a bit of swing
description: I'll have a stand there and probably have my wheel too. I would love to see you there, at Woolsey Bridge Fields, Diss. IP22 5SX

title: Southwold Street Festival
summary: Street entertainment, music, dance, choirs, stalls and local food and drink
description: Southwold High Street. 12 noon – 6.00pm. Free Entry. The Festival opens with a free street party which will begin with a circus themed parade. Enjoy an afternoon of street entertainment, music, dance, choirs, stalls and local food and drink.

title: Folk East
summary: A fresh approach to a timeless tradition
description: 'Suffused with good vibrations, quirky, charming, and possessed of a joie de vivre...'. I will be here at this beautiful festival along with other local potters. Have a go at throwing a pot! or simply come and browse our work. Glemham Hall Grounds, Suffolk

title: Art on the Prom
description: Art on the Prom is a free community event organised by a small group of volunteers. It will take place on Felixstowe's sea front on Sunday September 4th 2016.
